website_summaries.verdict: A stable and secure, folding alto and tenor sax stand for a good price.
pros: Adjustable neck and base so can custom fit different-sized altos as well as tenor saxes
Portable and comes with a bag for travel
cons: Doesn’t come with a clarinet peg

customer_reviews.title: I can't give this 5 stars from honesty. The ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't give this 5 stars from honesty. The way you guys have the saxophone in place in the picture is wrong. That can cause bent keys. The stand is wobbly and doesn't stand firm. It gets the job done though. Needs work though.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great sax stand!
customer_reviews.text: I think that this is a great sax stand. It holds the saxophone well without any metal touching the brass finish. It is stable and sturdy. It is well built and looks good. There might be more “top of the line” stands, but this one is working well for me. The price was good and the quality is great. My saxophone has a place to safely rest instead of just resting it agains the back of the couch in my practice room. This is a good item, you will not be disappointed. It does what it is supposed to do, without costing a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: The Client

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable - but damaged my Sax
customer_reviews.text: I am new to the sax. I thought that it would be better to have the sax stored on a stand, where it would be easier for me to pick up and practice often. My playing seemed to get worse and worse. Turns out it wasn't me. My sax had twisted, due to the weight of the instrument causing a shift in the body and bell. This also shifted the pads, leaving gaps for air to escape. I have folded the stand up - never to be used again, while I await the repair of my instrument.
customer_reviews.author: Grendel

customer_reviews.title: Does it’s job for cheap.
customer_reviews.text: Does a good job for the money. It doesn’t feel super sturdy and the bell receiver is a little too big. But I put it in a bench vice and slowly squeezed/bent it to fit my alto more snugly. Otherwise, it works. It’s made from good material, it’s just that it wiggles a little when you place your sax in it. Not a lot of movement. Just a little. I’m sure i could drill a hole and make a tightening screw to fix the wiggle. But the more i use it, the more I’m ok with it. If I played shows every weekend I may want to buy a nicer stand. But for now this does the job fine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Owenby

customer_reviews.title: Nice piece!
customer_reviews.text: This stand is a beauty. It folds to a little size to carry. Not heavy, but sturdy enough to place one's horn with confidence. Important Note: Whoever took the pictures did hang theirs in a wrong position. Be aware that the bell rests in the big top U, and the elbow rests in the little bottom one.
customer_reviews.author: cgar

customer_reviews.title: Nice stand for the price
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed at the sturdiness and fold-up convenience of this stand, especially compared to other much higher priced similar stands. I read a couple negative reviews on this product, and I'm not sure why they didn't like it. My alto sax hangs on this stand every time I play. I did intentionally bend (slightly) the top forks inward just a tad to allow my alto to hang more snug, but even with that this products gets five stars. Just can't beat the price for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Brock S. Henning

customer_reviews.title: Great sax stand for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure why I waited so long to get a stand for my Alto Sax. Great quality for less than $20. I would recommend this to anyone who needs a stand for their Alto Sax and does not want to spend a ton of money on it. This will look equally great on stage and in the music room. If you are looking for a sax stand but would rather spend your $$ on other things, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: Drew LaVacque

customer_reviews.title: Good for alto's, alright for tenor's
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty nice, feels like a solid stand. But my tenor sax is slightly big and heavy for it. I put the bell on the upper hook and let the body rest on the lower pad. The upper hook will sometimes collapse if you don't place the sax on it carefully. Maybe just needs to be tightened a bit more, but I've already tightened it quite a bit.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Grignon

customer_reviews.title: Definitely What I Was Looking For
customer_reviews.text: This product shipped right away and I received it in 2 days. The box was compact but nice and heavy. I opened it up and unfolded it and bam, there it was, no assembly required. Nice and sturdy, holds my tenor sax with no worries. Whenever I want to play I just grab it with one hand off the stand and wail.
customer_reviews.author: Joey C

customer_reviews.title: Loose pins
customer_reviews.text: It’s an OK stand. The design is good but one of the pins didnt work. The stand kept falling off. I had jam in stuffs to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: PSingh

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Good tool for the price. Had to force the upper bracket slightly to get it to lock the first time, but other than that it works well and is plenty sturdy. I just use it for short periods when practicing, but wouldn't hesitate to use on stage.
customer_reviews.author: PaulRT

customer_reviews.title: great stand
customer_reviews.text: it's easy to setup, to use and good quality. what else do you need? it folds for easy storage and carry. love it
customer_reviews.author: never again shop retail

customer_reviews.title: Great value and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Great size , easy to use . It is a little shaky and the tolerances could be a little tighter, but it gets the job done just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L.

customer_reviews.title: This is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I am learning to play the Alto Saxophone and the stand, cleaning supplies, and music stand were most needed. The products are great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best money spent for a saxophone tripod.
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and cost effective. I would add another attachment point at the bottom point of it. I would also consider adding extending legs like a tripod for more stability. This would increase the cost. For the price it's very effective and cost effecient.
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Ease of portablity
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Luvay stand not for a sax but for a friend's small Shofar. After a couple modifications it has worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Terry W.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and easy to collapse for transport. Supports instrument securely. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Autoharpist

customer_reviews.title: Performs as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: I like the stand. It performs its function as advertised. It's sturdy, easy to use. What else can anyone ask.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: ... three stands and this one is by far the best as it has a rubber strap the locks the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have bought counting this one three stands and this one is by far the best as it has a rubber strap the locks the bell in as the others don't. Love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job at Low Cost
customer_reviews.text: Cheap knockoff of a Hercules stand and not very well made, but does the job at less than half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Killersax

customer_reviews.title: Stable, strong and great quality
customer_reviews.text: Love it, great quality, allows to adjust, and it is very stable . Great purchase .
customer_reviews.author: E. Grijalva

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! Came quickly too. Bought for my son’s saxophone and it’s holding it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: BeanieB

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: After moving, wanted instruments on stands rather than in cases. This fits the bill perfectly and now the sax looks great next to the guitars.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As Close to Useless as Possible
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy! Hard to open! Won't Stay Closed! Pain in the ASS Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: Doug Daneliak

customer_reviews.title: The stand is nice. Holds the sax well
customer_reviews.text: The stand is nice. Holds the sax well, just make sure you hook the thumb hook on the bar.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea McCowan

customer_reviews.title: Tenor sax stand
customer_reviews.text: Buy it! This stand looks sleek and it’s very nice and lightweight but also very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: This product does what it is avdertized to do.
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the retainer strap, as it is stiff and doesn't want to fit easily avound the bell of even my Alto, much less my Tenor.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Wells

customer_reviews.title: Good price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandson as a present up to this time is working good as described he is happy
customer_reviews.author: EFREN REYNA

customer_reviews.title: Nice sturdy saxophone holder
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sturdy stand and looks nicer than some other stands that I looked at. My bother’s saxophone fit in it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: jgbrown

customer_reviews.title: Great stand for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my son's sax. Makes practicing so much easier and convenient because he doesn't need to unpack and repack every night.
customer_reviews.author: EAH

customer_reviews.title: Retailer needs to respond to messages.
customer_reviews.text: It was sturdy, but I did not have the strength to push the buttons to fold and unfold it. I sent it back. Before I sent it back I sent a message to the retailer requesting information to exchange it for a different one that I could fold and unfold, but they never responded.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie  Westfall

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Have had it less than a week
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Have had it less than a week, however, it looks very nice and seems to be sturdy. I thought it could have costed a little less for what you get, but overall we're happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Charo

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my sax out of the case for ease of use and keeps me motivated to play. Quite satisfied so far. Seams to be of good quality and construction.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Not good quality
customer_reviews.text: Too much wiggle in the joints after being locked in
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Palo

customer_reviews.title: Really nice Sax stand for alto
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy! I adjusted the bell forks closer together for my alto.. good deal
customer_reviews.author: Adam Tese

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: This is a great stand. It is sturdy yet compact and folds easily for storage or travel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: She loved it and its working perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my daughter. She loved it and its working perfectly. Only complaint is that its a bit flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: Quality not very good and is difficult to lock in position.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Connor

customer_reviews.title: Very nice stand for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and easy to use stand. Could be a big longer but it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied! Sax stand was just as described
customer_reviews.text: Very satisfied! Sax stand was just as described. Arrived promptly. I would definitely make another purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jacket

customer_reviews.title: Not For Tenor Sax
customer_reviews.text: This stand is too small to fit a Tenor Sax! Very disappointing-returning this item.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.000

customer_reviews.title: Easy folding and sturdy design
customer_reviews.text: The Alto Sax stand folds very nicely and is easy to pack. Sturdy design. Good price.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Very good, my sax now sits like a beautiful work of art in my room. I do not recommend setting it up like in the pics.
customer_reviews.author: Artur Leal Teixeira de Melo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. My earlier review only had 3 stars. That was a slip of the finger. It should have been 5. Hold the saxophone securely and was s breeze to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Stand is very sturdy and well balanced
customer_reviews.text: Arrived promptly. Securely packaged. Stand is very sturdy and well balanced. Everything is wanted and expected.
customer_reviews.author: Arleneee

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Seems to be sturdy. Suits my needs.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great stand, priced right
customer_reviews.text: Great stand, priced right. Photo shows sax in wrong position. larger upper fork holds bell, sax rest on lower fork. Turn sax in photo around 180 degrees. The stand is stable. compact, sturdy, well padded.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functions as advertised... good for price.
customer_reviews.text: Functionally good product, a few finishing things, like pipe plug on tubing needs to be better... But like it and works well.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Terrible stand!
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money on this stand. It is poorly made, flimsy, and didn't securely hold my tenor. The top piece was not straight and didn't stay up. I wouldn't trust this stand with any valuable instrument. I've owned many stands over the years and have never seen one this bad.
customer_reviews.author: David L Burg

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product I took it out of the box and ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product I took it out of the box and two different pins would not lock into the right spot due to being bent. It seemed as if someone used it and ruined it and I got it, even though I bought the item “brand new”
customer_reviews.author: corbin o.

product_meta.title: Luvay Alto/Tenor Sax Stand, Foldable(12") & Adjustable, Triangle Base Design
feature_bullets: Adjustable backrest for both alto and tenor sax
Foot is coated by quality rubber, anti-slip design
Locking pin fit, can be folded up, portable

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars137 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
